answers.answer: Fingerhead, let me start by thanking you for reaching out to this message board, and let me also say I am so sorry you are dealing with the complications of CF and type 1 diabetes.  But let me also say we are all volunteers and cannot give any medical advice pertaining to type 1 and/or CF.  As a

I wanted to let you know I checked with another online program that JDRF has called the Online Diabetes Support Team.  This question has come to this team as well, and while there are 90 volunteers who participate all who have a direct connection with type 1, none of them have CF as well.  I did find, in another response, these web sites that were recommended so I thought I would pass them along to you in case you haven

thank-you for your reply. i am of course in constant contact with all our medical team.... iwas looking for more emotional support and maybe contact with someone in a simular position. i live outside the u.s. and thought somewhere there may be more info than i already have
thank you for taking the time to pass these addresses on much appreciated

question: can you help a desperate mum with a child (13) with cystic fibrosis diagnosed with unrelated type 1 diabetes last may.she needs a high calorie diet for the c.f. i'm looking for any info on diet mamgement. tips and help much needed.
title: diabetes and cystic fibrosis
